Description: Hexagonal kursi (to store a copy of the Qur'an), imitating that of al-Nasir, Muhammad in the Islamic Museum, Cairo. Brass-plated, the upper plate inlaid silver in the form of central medallion with botched chinoiserie lotus scroll with flying panels of flying ducks. Inscription border, like the other inscriptions is a poor imitation of the original. Few of the side panels are openwork and the six legs screw on.
Associated names: Associated with: Sultan al-Nasir Muhammad ibn Qalawun
